title: 107_s400
content: Free Trade With Cuba Act - Amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to repeal the embargo placed upon all trade with Cuba. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to declare the denial of foreign tax credit inapplicable to Cuba. Permits: (1) installation and maintenance of telecommunications equipment and facilities in Cuba, including telecommunications services between the United States and Cuba. And (2) travel to and from Cuba by US citizens or residents. Requires the US Postal Service to provide direct mail service to and from Cuba. Urges the President to take all necessary steps to conduct negotiations with the Government of Cuba to: (1) settle claims of US nationals against Cuba for the taking of property, and (2) secure protection of internationally recognized human rights.
